channel.title: Jezebel
channel.description: Jezebel is gossip, culture, fashion, and sex for the contemporary woman.

item.title: For Team Newtown Strong, Boston Bombing Is a Tragedy Within a Tragedy
item.description:
In the days and weeks that follow the Boston Marathon bombing, media outlets will begin the grim task of sorting through a matryoshka doll of personal tragedies, although one such doubly tragic storyline has already emerged: the race was dedicated to the 26 victims of the Newtown school shooting, and not only did nine Newtown residents participate in the marathon itself, but families of the Newtown victims were offered a front-row view of yet another tragedy from the marathon's VIP section.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Saudi Prince: Women Should Drive Because of the Economy, Stupid
item.description:
Women can drive. I mean, of course women can drive. Anyone with the required faculties can drive, and the only possible reason a government can have for divesting women of the basic human right Henry Ford gave people to own a Model T and idle away hours of their lives in rush hour traffic is to limit their means of locomotion and, therefore, their independence, which is more or less how things stand in Saudi Arabia.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Beyoncé's Nipples Launch World Tour
item.description:
IT'S ALL HAPPENING. Beyoncé launched her Mrs. Carter World Tour in Belgrade, Serbia, wearing what can best be described as an R. Crumb illustration of an outfit.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Anna Breslaw

item.title: Since We Could All Use a Little Levity Right Now, Here's a Talking Dog
item.description:
This much we know to be true: dogs hate cats. But maybe they don't hate cats. Had you ever considered that? Had you ever considered that the only thing your dog ever wanted in this wide world of domestic animals was a kitten to cuddle and irritate for the entirety of its degraded feline life as the pet of a common dog? You should listen to your dog more often and not be so self-centered, jeez.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Reporter Uses Boston to Make a Poorly-Timed Point About Abortion
item.description:
That's what New York Magazine's Dan Amira suggested earlier today when he shared the following tweet Rubin sent a little more than an hour after news of the Boston Marathon explosions started making the social media rounds:

item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Poet Sharon Olds Scores a Sweet Pulitzer, Chills on Her Sweet Porch
item.description:
Sharon Olds sits on the porch of her home , Monday, April 15, 2013 in Pittsfield, N.H. Olds won the Pulitzer in poetry for Stag's Leap, a collection of poems. (AP Photo/Jim Cole)

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Florida’s Gross Giant Snail Problem Is Getting Way Out of Hand
item.description:
Let’s start here: fucking Florida. What a wet, wild, and all around icky place it is, you know? Florida is basically a big swamp surrounded by sand and populated almost exclusively with retired people, drug lords, rednecks, and dangerous exotic animals that entrepreneurial Floridians have decided to import into the balmy pet stores of South Florida and sell as pets to people who are just too eccentric to get a goddamn dog and call it a day.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: A Nice Thing Patton Oswalt Wrote After The Boston Marathon Bombing
item.description:
In the wake of events like today's, there's always an outpouring of "thoughts and prayers" and other sorts of well-intentioned signs of support from people all over social media that you almost get numb to it, if you're not already numb from the event itself.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Sean Newell

item.title: As if the Boston Marathon explosions weren't horrifying enough, CNN is reporting that one of the two
item.description:
As if the Boston Marathon explosions weren't horrifying enough, CNN is reporting that one of the two people killed was an 8-year-old boy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Celebrities React to the Tragedy in Boston
item.description:
Today, obviously, is completely awful, and celebrity news seems like the most frivolous shit ever right now. But, for the sake of routine, here it is. New Kid on the Block Joey McIntyre ran in the Boston marathon today—he says he finished about five minutes before the explosion. Also in the race was Survivor winner Ethan Zohn, who tweeted: "Most importantly, praying for those injured and affected by this. Still don’t have a lot of info. Thanks for your love and concern.” Famous people—being, of course, human beings—are just as dismayed and bewildered by today's events as the rest of us.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Lindy West

item.title: On top of everything else going on… Just curious: Have you filed your taxes?
item.description:
On top of everything else going on… Just curious: Have you filed your taxes?

item.title: Ryan Lochte Attempts to Contact Aliens with Secret Twitter Code
item.description:
Ryan Lochte has created his own six-letter secret code to speak to intelligent life forms, Howard Stern is copping Danny DeVito's #trollfoot steez, and Amanda Bynes is twerking some issues out.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Meher Ahmad

item.title: Yet Another Version of Romeo & Juliet and This One Has Chuck Bass in It
item.description:
Wait, what? Yet another film version of Romeo and Juliet is coming out and this one is starring (an age appropriate) Hailee Steinfeld, Ed Westwick, Damian Lewis and Paul Giamatti? And it's adapted for screen by Downton Abbey's Julian Fellowes? When did this happen? Better question — do we care that this is happening? Is this something that we want/need to see? Tell me how to feel, Internet!

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Game of Boners: One Hand, One Heart
item.description:
Welcome to Game of Boners, your weekly tally of all the nudity that appears on everyone's favorite fantasy fuck fest, Game of Thrones. Every Monday, we will recap each boob, buttock and sex act that appears on camera, along with some other fun facts from the episode that may or may not have anything to do with sex whatsoever. Keep a box of tissues on hand because Winter is definitely coming.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Sick Tourists Marrying Teenage 'One Month Brides' for Sex in India
item.description:
The act of child prostitution is getting a whole 'nother level of terrible in Hyderabad, India. A 17-year-old girl who was sold to a Sudanese man as a "one month wife" ran away from her so-called husband, exposing the increase of such sham marriages for the purpose of sex tourism in the the country. The phenomenon is becoming increasingly popular, no thanks to government appointed Muslim priests called Qazis, local fixers and wealthy foreigners.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Meher Ahmad

item.title: When It Comes to Vaccinations, Some Moms Would Rather Listen to Their Pilates Instructors than Their Doctors
item.description:
Despite thorough debunkings of the purported links between vaccinations and autism, plenty of parents are still conflicted about whether or not to adhere to the CDC's guidelines. In the county where I live—King County, in Washington state—vaccination rates are below the national average, and, not-so-coincidentally, we're also experiencing pertussis and measles outbreaks. So where are parents getting advice to opt out of vaccinations? Their social networks, natch. I mean, that lady from Zumba gave me really good advice about whether or not my mole looked funky, so why not prioritize her opinion over my doctor's when it comes to major public health decisions affecting immunocompromised children who just want to go to school without dying of mumps?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Lindy West

item.title: Fashion Scavenger Hunt: Help Find This Cut-Out Crop Top
item.description:
Welcome to Fashion Scavenger Hunt, a new column to help you track down your favorite products — clothes, makeup, shoes, whatever — that have been discontinued or otherwise lost in the passage of time and quickie fashion trends. Email katie@jezebel.com to submit your own "wanted" ads.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Katie J.M. Baker

item.title: Boston PD: Marathon Explosions Are an ‘Ongoing Event’ [Update]
item.description:
Boston Police Commissioner Edward Davis has described the two horrific explosions at the Boston Marathon as part of “an ongoing event” after a third explosion occurred about an hour ago at the John F. Kennedy Presidential library, five miles southeast of the Boston Marathon finish line in Copley Square.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Ask a Winegeek
item.description:
So, you Groupthinkers probably know me as the gleeful purveyor of gummi reviews and baked goods, but in fact, the field I'd dare to claim any kind of expertise in is the vast consumption of the fermented juice of the grape.

item.dc:creator: chritter is a nocturnal feminist mancatfish

item.title: Explosions At The Boston Marathon; 3 Dead, Scores Injured
item.description:
Minutes after two bombs exploded near the finish line of the Boston Marathon at 2:50 p.m., reports started rolling in. We began this post soon after, with chronological updates continuing through the evening. Some photos might be graphic.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Barry Petchesky

item.title: The Veronica Mars movie finished its Kickstarter campaign having raised $5,702,153, proving you shou
item.description:
The Veronica Mars movie finished its Kickstarter campaign having raised $5,702,153, proving you should never bet against the pluck and resourcefulness of teen girl detective.

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Trans Punk Singer Writes About Her First Year as a Woman
item.description:
Against Me! singer Laura Jane Grace penned a pretty incredible personal essay for Cosmopolitan detailing the changes in her life in the year since she came out to her family as trans.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jenna Sauers

item.title: Mad Men: Is Don Draper a Sex Addict?
item.description:
After last week's season premiere served us a two-hour meditation on death, last night's Mad Men was all about sex, which should be a much happier topic as it's the antithesis of death. But with this episode taking place the January after the Summer of Love, the gang is squarely in the winter of their discontent, faced with how sex doesn't just create life, it can also destroy it.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tracie Egan Morrissey

item.title: Congrats to CNN's chief international correspondent Christiane Amanpour, who will receive the Arab A
item.description:
Congrats to CNN's chief international correspondent Christiane Amanpour, who will receive the Arab American Institute Foundation's first-ever Anthony Shadid Award for Excellence in Journalism. The prize is named after the New York Times journalist who died in Syria last year.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Carey Mulligan Says Daisy Buchanan Is 'Like A Kardashian'
item.description:
Carey Mulligan is on the cover of Vogue, in character as Daisy Buchanan. Baz Luhrmann's adaptation of The Great Gatsby is finally set to premiere on May 15. Mulligan tells the magazine that she based her characterization of Daisy on two real women from F. Scott Fitzgerald's life: his wife, Zelda Fitzgerald, and a girl named Ginevra King whom he wooed as a teenager. Princeton, where Fitzgerald's papers are archived, provided copies of the writer's correspondence with King for Mulligan to read. King once wrote to Fitzgerald, "‘There’s so little to me that I’m not hard to forget quickly." Zelda said, "I seem always curiously interested in myself, and it’s so much fun to stand off and look at me." Mulligan says of Daisy:

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jenna Sauers
